org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.brk

Class WebSocketProxyListenerBreak

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.brk.WebSocketProxyListenerBreak
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WebSocketObserver

    public class WebSocketProxyListenerBreak
extends Object
implements WebSocketObserver
    Gets notified about WebSocket messages and checks if breakpoint applies.

      • getObservingOrder

        public int getObservingOrder()
        Description copied from interface: WebSocketObserver
        The observer with the lowest ordering value will receive the message first.
        Specified by:
        getObservingOrder in interface WebSocketObserver
        Returns:
        observing order

      • onMessageFrame

        public boolean onMessageFrame(int channelId,
                     WebSocketMessage wsMessage)
        Description copied from interface: WebSocketObserver
        Called by the observed class (WebSocketProxy) when a new part of a message arrives.

        Use WebSocketMessage.isFinished() to determine if it is ready to process. If false is returned, the given message part will not be further processed (i.e. forwarded).

        Specified by:
        onMessageFrame in interface WebSocketObserver
        wsMessage - contains message parts received so far
        Returns:
        True for continuing to notify and forwarding message

      • onStateChange

        public void onStateChange(WebSocketProxy.State state,
                 WebSocketProxy proxy)
        Description copied from interface: WebSocketObserver
        Called by the observed class (WebSocketProxy) when its internal WebSocketProxy.state changes.

        This state does not only represent all possible WebSocket connection states, but also state changes that affect how messages are processed.

        Specified by:
        onStateChange in interface WebSocketObserver
        Parameters:
        state - new state
